website_summaries.verdict: An effective spray that works on pets as well as carpets and furniture.
pros: This powerful spray uses natural and organic ingredients to instantly kill pests at all stages of life and prevent future infestations
The spray is pH-balanced to be easy on skin and can soothe itching or rashes
Available in a range of sizes from 4 oz
cons: This spray does contain some unnatural ingredients, and some customers reported a powerful smell

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed in the changes made in this product
customer_reviews.text: Disappointed in the changes made in this product. It used to be all natural but they have added unhealthy ingredients! The new added ingredient are Not good for Pets or humans. I did love the old product as it did have all natural ingredients.
customer_reviews.author: Cat

customer_reviews.title: Smells great. Could visibly see it working on our cats ...
customer_reviews.text: Smells great. Could visibly see it working on our cats and could see dead bugs coming off them the next day. For the price, this is the best flea/tick solution i have came across. Definitely recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Spencer W.

customer_reviews.title: Wth Did I Buy?!
customer_reviews.text: Why on earth would your instructions include "spray" & you don't provide a spray nozzle?! When I peeled the seal off the lemongrass scent, my eyes watered and I sneezed twice. put a small amount on a papertowel, rubbed my pet's legs and she sneezed and tried to wipe it off on the carpet for quite some time. This product is too expensive to cut corners on a friggin spray nozzle. Very disappointed. I'm not sure whether or not it works yet but my dog hates it, my nose hates it & I'm annoyed by the lack of a spray nozzle. Don't advertise this as a spray bottle if it doesn't come in one.
customer_reviews.author: Spoiled Brat

customer_reviews.title: Yellow bottle is NOT for CATS!
customer_reviews.text: The name of the product says it's for dogs AND cats - but the yellow bottle, which is the first on the list when opening up the link, has lemongrass oil, which IS toxic to cats. False advertising in my opinion. Have to go to the Wondercide website to find the ingredients list it SHOULD be right up front on the Amazon site.
customer_reviews.author: Just a typical woman

customer_reviews.title: Not sure if lemon grass is good for your dog
customer_reviews.text: This review is 2 years late, but I really felt I should write it. I’m disappointed that I did this to my dog. I thought it was all natural and it would be good for her. But lemon grass burns. And she gave me those puppy eyes like what are you putting on me? I didn’t know any better, I sprayed it all over the coach, the rugs and then I didn’t realized until a lot later that my skin doesn’t like lemon grass and started getting rashes. I ended up moving out of that apartment. Everyone is different, but this is what I learned while using this product. Maybe your skin won’t be as sensitive?
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Overpowering Strong Scent
customer_reviews.text: I just received this order for my 3 Pomeranians, wow that first spray was STRONG. Each dog went into a sneezing fit as I've never put anything like this on them. They did not enjoy the spray down and I had to let them air out for awhile in the sun to dry out. Their fur stayed oily for about an hour and is still weighted down after several hours but it's not sticky so it's not too bad. i can't imagine spraying this all over the house- the smell although not bad (citronella) is just too much. Really hoping it works for them with an upcoming camping trip otherwise I am back to using medicated flea and tick meds.
customer_reviews.author: Lesley C.

customer_reviews.title: Didn’t end up working for me.
customer_reviews.text: Pros: I liked the smell at first. I liked that you could use it on your pets safely. I sprayed it on wood floors and it didn’t harm them. Cons: my husband hated the smell. Then I realized that it was making me cough because it was so strong. MOST IMPORTANTLY I didn’t see a change in the flea issue we were having on our kitten. Also I only put it on her once and it was way too strong for a 4 month old kitten so I never did again.
customer_reviews.author: Adrinna D.

customer_reviews.title: Leaking nozzle wastes way too much, which wastes a ton of the product!
customer_reviews.text: The spray nozzle or the seal leaks all over the place! I'm willing to spend good money on quality product, but not when a quarter of the bottle is wasted on it leaking out the seal before the first use. The stuff has a very strong scent, which is good for its purpose, but not when you have it all over The place from leaking! I've used it twice since I got it, and it's nearly half gone. Not sure if I got a defective bottle but this is a total waste of money and product! Very disappointed!
customer_reviews.author: Christy and Dave

customer_reviews.title: Works well. Strong scent
customer_reviews.text: My dogs has been flea free. I like that this is a natural product. Unfortunately during high flea season it does need to be applied frequently. Lemongrass is a great essential oil to repel bugs, but it is really really strong in this product. I don't care for the scent of lemongrass, I prefer the cedar, but it works so I tolerate the scent. It does last for several days before reapplication is needed. It sprays on easy and not a lot is needed for each application so a bottle lasts longer than expected. It is still a little pricey though.
customer_reviews.author: Crystal Small

customer_reviews.title: Helpful but not 100% deterrent/preventative 🤷🏽‍♀️
customer_reviews.text: PROS: I’ve watched this spray stop fleas dead in their tracks within a minute. CONS: the smell makes me soooo NAUSEATED!!! It’s so POTENT! Also, not sure it works that well as a deterrent, maybe unless the dog is SOAKING WET in it. It doesn’t seem to keep the fleas away 100%. Shrug 🤷🏽‍♀️ so much for a NATURAL preventative/deterrent! I’ve still continued to find fleas for days later.. oddly enough, only 1, visible Little-medium size flea in the hair, days after use. A 10 minute dawn bath revealed up to 2-4 little fleas. 😤
customer_reviews.author: K3FitInc

customer_reviews.title: Cedar oil spray works great!!
customer_reviews.text: I wasnt notified it was on the back porch area & just discovered it about 30 minutes later. It was used to treat fleas & mosquitos indoors in case they were to enter from outside. Amazing smell. I also used it on my cat by spraying it onto a rag & then rubbing cat down. Cat is indoors so only 1 treatment needed per month & it worked within a few minutes!! Fleas were gone dead & house smelled amazing for several hours! since I have wooden flooring it will last for up to 1 week & I love cedar & lemongrass too so great combination !
customer_reviews.author: IrishEyes37

customer_reviews.title: I'm pleased with the effectiveness
customer_reviews.text: I recently had a flea problem in the carpet of my screened porch. Every time I went out to clean cat pans or pet my fur babies, fleas would jump on me. I had to stop to kill them every time I came back in the house. I used this on my legs while I was pilling the cats and spraying the carpet. It works well for me. It doesn't last long enough for the carpet, so I use something much stronger for that. But it sure made me comfortable while I was doing so. I'm also planning to use it at night when the blind mosquitoes become a nuisance.
customer_reviews.author: J Silvasy

customer_reviews.title: LIFE CHANGING - Dust Mites
customer_reviews.text: This stuff changed my life! I am extremely allergic to dust mites and these sprays eliminated them and their allergens on all my furniture and bedding. The scents are REALLY strong. But they are natural scents, not chemical scents, so they are easier for the body to process. I am very sensitive to chemical scents and these only bother me for about 10 minutes but then they dissipate. I will stay outside or in another room during that time because the magic IS WORTH IT. I even spray my pillows and have come to find the scent on my pillows comforting knowing I am sleeping microscopic bug free.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah

customer_reviews.title: It works and I love the scent!
customer_reviews.text: This is a re-order. I love this product and the scent allows it to be used inside. I live in the south and in summer it's almost impossible to keep critters out, so I spray around the bed and edges of walls and around doors/windows to deter biting bugs. It works for me as I cannot stand the smell of commercial fungicides and this does not hurt my pets. The lemongrass is one of my favourite scents... wish it also came in lavender to deter scorpions even further. It came well packed and delivery was quick. Will order again and again.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: worked
customer_reviews.text: It is a very strong scent, easy to apply if your dog does not freak out and works!. 2 of my dogs did great being sprayed with this, the other 3 took off every time they saw bottle. Was able to get them twice with it. It does work. They really only had fleas, no ticks. Nice scent, really strong at first then dies down some. I got the lemongrass. Took the doggy smell right out of them. Have not done my cats yet, but will buy again. In the beginning used once a day. Now every other day. Maybe less now that fleas seem to be very little now.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Happy to find an alternative to chemicals
customer_reviews.text: We do not use chemicals to treat our dog during flea/tick season as he has seizures (side effect of those products). However, we wanted to use a product that would help prevent his exposure during the prime season while out in the yard Have applied twice now with no ticks/fleas found. Lemongrass scent is a little strong but it's better than putting pesticides on our dog.
customer_reviews.author: K. Perry

customer_reviews.title: I am so disappointed. Reviews made it look wonderful. No sprayer rendered it useless.
customer_reviews.text: One star for misleading product image. I ordered a 16 oz. spray bottle. I got a bottle with a CAP and no sprayer. It may come to a shock to some but the reason I buy stuff on amazon is there are no places in my area that sell a lot of things like this. I don’t use sprayers in general and the one I do have in my Windex is the wrong diameter. So I’m going to be returning this, unopened because it is totally useless. I want to spritz on pet bedding. Not pour.
customer_reviews.author: Kitchen Mouse

customer_reviews.title: Good product with some problems.
customer_reviews.text: Product is great. But the bottle leaks. Whenever you squeeze the trigger, your hand gets wet. Also, while I Iike the scent, my granddaughter does not. More importantly, the dogs do not. The smaller dog refused to use his bed for several hours after we sprayed it. It does kill the bad guy insects though, thank goodness.
customer_reviews.author: Len B

customer_reviews.title: The real deal
customer_reviews.text: Well my dogs run like hell from it because as soon as you spray it on you can see the fleas running for their lives or biting them all over from anger and the dog goes nuts, this lasted about 10 mins before it simmered off then my dogs were pissed at me for the day... But it does work
customer_reviews.author: Charlene

customer_reviews.title: GREAT PRODUCT!!!
customer_reviews.text: I HIGHLY recommend this product! All natural and repels fleas etc...... I use this around the house also. It gets rid of the little ants, and small bugs that try to get in through the door jams. I feel better about using this product on my older dog because the traditional flea prevention is so toxic, so I just use a small amount in the summer months and put this product on.
customer_reviews.author: Native Austinite

customer_reviews.title: It Works!
customer_reviews.text: This is a effective product if you’re not wanting to use poisonous chemicals to keep your dog free of fleas. I live in a suburban area so I don’t deal with ticks, but my pups do come in contact with fleas and occasionally a mosquito or two. I’ve found that you have to be diligent in using this product, but it does work. If you spot a flea, a quick squirt and it’s dead. Also, it’s a good deterrent. The only thing lacking is that it seems to wear off quickly and needs to be reapplied fairly often when taking your dogs out. I would recommend Wondercide.
customer_reviews.author: Cindy E

customer_reviews.title: We quit using the prescription chemical
customer_reviews.text: We just began using this on Honey, our Hungarian Bird Dog who is mostly outside. She has been biting herself a lot this year. I roughed up her coat and sprayed her with the Lemongrass scent. She rolled all over the porch so we knew something was happening! As day went on she did very little biting and scratching. We reapplied this morning. She’s very sensitive but doesn’t seem to mind this stuff. So far so good.
customer_reviews.author: parmstro

customer_reviews.title: Give it a try...
customer_reviews.text: I purchased Wondercide,(lemon grass scent) after reading other positive reviews about the product. I found the product easy to apply both to the dog's beds and blankets - I didn't apply it directly onto their skin - although you can, i just didn't. The scent is heavy yet pleasant, but if you're sensitive to fragrances I would recommend spraying the product in phases and or open some windows. As for it's effectiveness...by all accounts it worked. It's just that I used Wondercide along with diatomaceous earth. However, for the price and overall performance, I highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Tracy

customer_reviews.title: Too strong
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this after reading all the reviews and chose to order the lemon grass. When it arrived, I sprayed it as directed. The odor is pervasive and strong, as others have noted. It lingers for hours and days. Therefore, I can't use it daily as directed and will not be ordering it again as, during summer, airing out the house is not an option. Good idea...horribly strong odor.
customer_reviews.author: Denise E.

customer_reviews.title: Good against fleas, but useless against ticks
customer_reviews.text: Works fine against fleas, but it doesn't work against ticks. The smell is super strong and may be offensive to some people. I sprayed my dog with wondercide and a few hours later I found many ticks on his legs, I even took one tick and sprayed it directly with wondercide and it did nothing to the tick, even after several minutes. I'm giving two stars since the information on the bottle label says that wondercide kills and repels ticks. I continue spraying my dog for several days, but the ticks did not disapear, I even spray his bed, the floor and blankets with no results.
customer_reviews.author: David Galli

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: I use this on myself when I go outside, and it seems to work well keeping mosquitoes away. I'm usually not out for a long time, so I don't know how well it lasts. I also use it on my dog, and I find that it works much better as a flea repellent than the drops that he hates. The cedar smell is really strong, so some people might be turned off by that. The nice lemony scent helps tone it down, though. I just like knowing I'm not putting harmful chemicals on myself or my dogs. I will say I've gotten great customer service from them, too.
customer_reviews.author: JJ

customer_reviews.title: Doesn’t work at all on our dogs
customer_reviews.text: One star because that’s the minimum. I was so happy to get this natural product and be able to stop using the Seresto collars. But unfortunately it doesn’t work. We bathed and sprayed our dogs with these products yesterday and took them for grooming today and they had tons of fleas. Plus it made their fur stiff and dirty-feeling, and they sneezed at the smell. So, in the trash it goes, and I ordered more Seresto collars for tomorrow delivery, and called to set up spraying the yard with chemicals. I’m weary of the choice between chemicals and fleas.
customer_reviews.author: Carolyn C.

customer_reviews.title: Made my cats sick
customer_reviews.text: This product did not work and kept leaking from the cap. I ended up return it because the few times I did use it my cats immediately went to lick themselves. They both puked and I did not even spray that much on them. The smell is nice but I also didn’t notice any change on my flea situation. I hate to say it but I’m going back to the frontline brand
customer_reviews.author: Ash.trology

customer_reviews.title: Really does keep fleas off my dog
customer_reviews.text: My dog is very sensitive to flea medications, so I can't use them. She is also allergic to fleas. We had a flea infestation when our condo complex got new mulch. A friend said to spray this on my dog before she goes out. My dog is a bichon/poodle and fleas love to jump on her. This did keep the fleas away. I also sprayed the mulch near our door and it seemed to help so I didn't get bitten when out there.
customer_reviews.author: wica

customer_reviews.title: Very disappointed
customer_reviews.text: I read the reviews and ordered this product. I couldn't be more disappointed. It seems marketing has run wild. I used it several times on my dog and saw little if any results. My dog runs when she sees me reach for this. The smell is very strong. It discolored my dog's white coat. As to the product one sprays in the yard: there's no reasonable way to tell how much has been applied or how much is left. In the sponsor's answers to questions about this, they say hold the bottle up to strong sunlight and one can see what's left in the bottle. Good luck with that. Off to the Vet to get real product.
customer_reviews.author: David Siciliano

customer_reviews.title: Good back up
customer_reviews.text: I wanted this to be the only thing to use for fleas and ticks, but unfortunately I still have to use oral treatment. I just moved to NC and never had to deal with fleas and ticks in CO. The first day I got here my dog got a tick and fleas immediately. This was my first go to, but just wasn't enough. She has a dog door and is outside a lot. Maybe if your dog isn't outside a lot and you are dedicated to the spray you would see good results. Unfortunately I just couldn't rely solely on this. I do still use it as backup when we go for hikes and I love the scent.
customer_reviews.author: SMitchell

customer_reviews.title: Dogs Good, Cats Bad
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this product because it was safe to use on both cats and dogs. Our dogs were fine, had no problems with the applications. I don't think they like it, but they are tolerating it. My cat had a poor reaction, and shortly after application she began to foam at the mouth. We quickly rinsed it all from her coat and she was fine afterwards. So far, I'm not seeing how it kills fleas on contact, but I've been using it regularly on the dogs in hopes to keep additional fleas at bay.
customer_reviews.author: J. Layton

customer_reviews.title: Missing sprayer!
customer_reviews.text: Can't use it so not able to make any reference to how it works because I wasn't sent a sprayer+. Previous comments had same issue and response was it should have one in package, pulled package out the trash and double checked, nothing inside. Okkkk! This needs to be resolved and mistake needs to cease.
customer_reviews.author: Darlene DeSario

customer_reviews.title: It works well!
customer_reviews.text: We, my cat and me, can’t stand the scent. At first it smells like lemon but at the end it smells like wet hay. The cat freaks out when she smells it now. She lets out a mournful cry. But it works fast. I now comb her cost with a flea comb and spray the fleas on a paper towel soaked with solution. They die immediately. Amazing and grateful that I can use something this effective without hurting her. I just have to learn how to sneak it on to coat!
customer_reviews.author: D.O.

customer_reviews.title: Like this product
customer_reviews.text: I love this product, I did have the rosemary one and was not a fan of the scent, hopefully I will like the lemon grass scent better. This really helped us get rid of our flea problem, without all the harmful chemicals.
customer_reviews.author: Jen

customer_reviews.title: Must have natural product
customer_reviews.text: Awesome product. Was using a different product for years- some dog enthusiasts turned me on to this one. Not disappointed at all- will continue to purchase and I also bought all their other products too.
customer_reviews.author: smartie

customer_reviews.title: Not worth the money
customer_reviews.text: Oh well, another expensive natural flea spray that doesn’t seem to work. After spraying my dogs, I combed out some fleas, thinking it was working. Except the fleas were alive and so i saturated them with the spray and they were still alive. The scent is also very strong. My conclusion is if saturating the fleas doesn’t kill them, then then product clearly doesn’t work. Atleast my whole house smells like Pledge.
customer_reviews.author: perch

customer_reviews.title: Will purchase again...
customer_reviews.text: I really like this product. We have a pup that does not react well to traditional, chemical medications. Though our pups have never had fleas or ticks, we want to keep it that way without those other products. As a deterrent, I spray all indoor fabrics periodically...bedding, carpets, etc...and, brush this on the pups after their weekly/biweekly baths depending on the season. We also tend to brush this on again after hiking or other extended outdoor activities. I first purchased the cedar, which I love the smell of, but our sensitive pup was not a huge fan. He responded better to the lemongrass, and I plan to try the rosemary soon.
customer_reviews.author: J Wolfy62

customer_reviews.title: Seems to be working.
customer_reviews.text: I have two Boston Terrier pups and did not want to go with the feed-thru tick and flea meds. So I am trying Wondercide. I ordered the sample pack first to test if it works, be sure my dogs were not allergic, and determine which scent I like best. Ended up ordering the lemongrass in the large bottle. So far this product seems to be working and the ticks this year are terrible. I have not found a tick on them yet and we take morning and afternoon walks in the grass. Fingers Crossed
customer_reviews.author: Vol Fan

customer_reviews.title: Product is not for all dogs!!!
customer_reviews.text: I used the product that I purchased at a store. It was just a small bottle. I went to Amazon to buy more as the product really worked. However, they sent a different scent - lemon. It would have been aright if I didn't have a white dog. My dog turned yellow!!!! I took him to the groomers and they did as best they could, but my white dog still has yellow all over him! I can't believe that there was no warning not to use on white dogs!
customer_reviews.author: Ellen Jacoby

customer_reviews.title: CHEMICALS-TOO MANY
customer_reviews.text: THE PRODUCT HAS A VERY VERY STRONG SMELL! I PERSONALLY DONT THINK ITS GOOD FOR KITTENS!! I FOUND SOME KITTENS THAT WERE FULL OF FLEAS AND HAD UPPER RESPIRATORY PROBLEMS. USED THE SPRAY AND THE FLEAS WENT AWAY BUT THEIR HEALTH BECAME WORSE. THIS PRODUCT IS TOO STRONG...AND ONLY FOR HEALTHY CATS...AND ONLY TO BE USED AWAY FROM NOSE IN SMALL QUANTITY.
customer_reviews.author: kerstin Eskeli

customer_reviews.title: Wondercide works great for my hound
customer_reviews.text: I bought this bug repellant to keep biting bugs off my poor Basset Hound. We recently moved to Florida and my Basset loves to lounge in the grass in the sunshine. The first few days we were here she got some nasty bug bites even though I had sprayed her with Dr Mercola bug repellant. I decided to look for a different natural spray with cedar oil in it and Wondercide seems to be working well. I spray her every day and she can now lounge and the bugs are staying away.
customer_reviews.author: threehounds

customer_reviews.title: Works as advertised
customer_reviews.text: This merchandise came in a sealed, no leakage bubble wrapped packaging box. We have purchased a time or two prior and just as those times, we were and are completely satisfied with the effectiveness of the all natural formula when it becomes necessary to spray some on our three terriers. Towards the end of the summer, their coats had gotten a bit on the thick sides and there were a few instances after their thrice-a-day walks where we noticed dead and/or dying fleas (they receive monthly oral treatment). Wondercide to the rescue quick, fast and in a hurry! We intend to keep a bottle for these occurences ('tis best to have and not need than to need and not have...)
customer_reviews.author: Keith Marshall

customer_reviews.title: Warning! Very Pungent Smell!
customer_reviews.text: I opened the package ready to use the Wondercide to find a bottle with no sprayer. So that was annoying. Read the bottle and followed instructions and sprayed all around house. I REALLY wish there was a warning about how STRONG this was! I anticipated a smell obviously but my lord I sprayed A LOT and the smell was so intense I got a headache. Plus side it wasn’t a bad smell. I’m not sure yet how it’s going to do in the long run. Fingers crossed I made the right choice in picking this product.
customer_reviews.author: Marissa O.

customer_reviews.title: Spray in hand and rub on small dogs
customer_reviews.text: Works...but it has a strong oder. My pet would not lie in his bed...Had to wash it. But it did get rid of fleas. Spray comes out to much for a small dog...you must put in hand and rub in.
customer_reviews.author: Theresa F

customer_reviews.title: Like giving Gizmo water after midnight
customer_reviews.text: This stuff is absolute GARBAGE. Not only did it grease all 3 of my dogs and cats up like pigs. It made them all look like they just climbed out of a trash can. On top of that. After dosing everything in my house down the fleas decided I was their next target. I now look like I was swarmed by bees. After a day not only did my babies have fleas again. They multiplied. Not by two or three either. It's literally like someone gave Gizmo water after midnight. The fleas are back. 10 fold. With a vengence. I now get to poison my babies in hopes of getting rid of these bugs. Everyone who wrote great reviews. Lied.
customer_reviews.author: Jamie Geesey

customer_reviews.title: Effective and chemical free!
customer_reviews.text: Based on many great reviews, I decided to try another holistic product. I'm happy to report that my tick magnet dog had a couple on his coat, which I removed. They appeared to be effected by the spray. I didn't find any that were attached and eating! I've found a winner! I also spray my hiking shoes to repel ticks and the closet walls to repel wool eating moths. I like the smell, and Vito isn't bothered by it as he was from other holistic products. Awesome product!!
customer_reviews.author: Ellen Segale

customer_reviews.title: Works great for my two frenchies
customer_reviews.text: This stuff works awesome even stops the horseflies from biting my two pups. I was nervous seeing some reviews about having a reaction because my frenchies have incredibly sensitive skin but their skin is fine. Finally can let them hang out in the yard without getting eaten alive by mosquitos and horseflies.
customer_reviews.author: KO1189

customer_reviews.title: Safe, smells good, and effective
customer_reviews.text: We live in an older neighborhood with a neighborhood flea problem. We don’t have any pets but we do have a 3 month old baby. We ended up with a flea problem in our house and got this spray to follow up our salt and vacuum method. Used this on our surfaces twice (and their yard product) and fleas are gone. Lemongrass smells great, safe for baby.
customer_reviews.author: alihalpe

customer_reviews.title: Not what I was hoping for
customer_reviews.text: I really wanted to love this product since I am not a fan of using toxic chemicals. However, this was a hit and a miss. The product did not come with a spray nozzle (which is misleading given that the picture has one), it did not smell as pleasant (I got the lemongrass scent), it did not do anything to get rid of ticks on my 12 pound dog and it left a sticky residue. I am wondering if the product would have been different if I bought it straight from the Wondercide website. Very disappointed :-(
customer_reviews.author: Trae

customer_reviews.title: This stuff works on fleas!!!
customer_reviews.text: This stuff really works! It handled a bad flea problem in our yard. I also bought the lawn spray too! It’s wonderful and not dangerous to get on skin! I’m impressed! Yes you have it use it more Often than poisonous products but that’s the trade off for using an effective natural product! It works on our dog too! And the lemongrass smell is very pleasant!
customer_reviews.author: Ray Bernard

customer_reviews.title: Does not work. Has a very strong terrible smell.
customer_reviews.text: One of the worst flea products I've ever tried. My dog's and cat's still have fleas. I've used multiple times now. The smell of this product id so strong it gives me a headache, makes me feel nauseous and smells up the whole house when it's used. If it bothers me, I can only imagine how it makes my dog's feel. I bought it because I thought it would be safe to use around my toddler and I tried to save a lot of money by not using the normal oral flea medication I get from my vet. Lesson learned.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: ingredients
customer_reviews.text: I have used yard and pet/home product for one year now and seem to have great success with it. I have been trying to use products that won't harm my pets. However, i just read the ingredients and wasn't really happy to see that the product contains sodium lauryl sulfate (natural) whatever natural means. I was a hairstylist years ago and we were told to never use any shampoos with that item in it. So, I will continue my search to find the very least harmful product for my pets. Otherwise, I like the product very much and it seems to work very well.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Indifferent
customer_reviews.text: I definitely can't just spray this on my cat, because spray bottles are associated with training bad behavior... So I opted to spray down rugs, chairs/furniture/carpet etc. Scent in VERY STRONG. I honestly have no idea if it is working because both cats still have fleas, with continuous brushing and applied flea meds. I think if you have one small cat/not a large infestation, this product seems promising for a chemical alternative/maybe excellent for prevention. But with multi-outdoor cat home, eggs are hiding EVERYWHERE. It seems like you need multiple products for attacking indoor & outdoor, and it is just too expensive in my opinion. Although it has only been 4 days since spraying down my home.
customer_reviews.author: Jynell B.

customer_reviews.title: It has worked just fine for my dogs
customer_reviews.text: This is my second purchase of Wonderside Flea and Tick Spray. My first purchase was last year and the second this year. It has worked just fine for my dogs. My back yard has a fence and is surrounded on 2 sides with trees and different types of bushes. When I start seeing fleas and mosquitos I spray Wonderside on my 3 dogs twice a week. I find that it is a protection for them. I do not like using anything toxic on my dogs. So far, I am satisfied with this product.
customer_reviews.author: Millie O

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: When I first got this product I sprayed a little inside a baggie and brushed our cat to get a few fleas. I put the live fleas in the baggie and they died immediately after touching the liquid. I tried it multiple times and every time they died right away. My cats didn’t like the smell because it is quite strong, but it works great!
customer_reviews.author: Jessica

customer_reviews.title: Seller not being clear on item
customer_reviews.text: I've used this product before and I love it. I ordered from this seller thinking that I would get the same thing. I did, except with NO NOZZLE. Nowhere in the description does it state "without nozzle", or "bottle only", or etc. Seller needs to include the nozzle, so it can be readily used, or include in description that there is no nozzle. I'm not happy about this situation. But I am happy with my Wondercide.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Did not like.
customer_reviews.text: We got this for our dogs to help with fleas and mosquitoes. It helped the mosquito issue outside (ie we sprayed it around our backyard) but it did nothing for the fleas. And the smell was way too strong. It made our dogs itchier then the fleas did and one of our dogs couldn't stop sneezing at the smell. It may have to do with where we live (dry area, flat) but I stopped using it and won't use it again on our dogs.
customer_reviews.author: Audrey

customer_reviews.title: Natural Help!
customer_reviews.text: Very good product. Smell is strong so don’t overdo. Animals sensitivity to smells, best to spray in hand and rub on pet. Will also be using on myself for mosquitos. My pets both give me the evil eye when I apply the chemical flea/tick on them. (Cat/dog)...It’s like a look of betrayal. I trust their instincts and why I was looking and ordered a safer product.
customer_reviews.author: J Roth

customer_reviews.title: Very pleased with results
customer_reviews.text: Wow, really works! Spent over $200 on fancy flea collars, money down the toilet. You have to give a squirt about every 7-10 days, but that's no big deal. Don't spray too much at once, has a strong citronella odor, but doesn't linger too long. Has really helped with the flea problem, and hasn't reacted badly with my aging doxies. I like that I can spray them and the house with the same product.
customer_reviews.author: Crazygrandma

customer_reviews.title: Works!
customer_reviews.text: This works great and I feel better knowing it is a lot safer than the traditional chemicals out there most commonly used to treat fleas and ticks. I love my babies, so this is our go-to in our home to treat our three pups and their beds. Knowing the ingredients are natural and safe is the most important factor for me. I just wish this scent wasn't so strong (it is VERY strong) as our one pup really hates it. The other two honestly don't mind too much it seems.
customer_reviews.author: Aggie

customer_reviews.title: Nice scent and I like the fact that it's natural
customer_reviews.text: Nice scent and I like the fact that it's natural, but it's not very effective. In fact, it didn't kill fleas in the carpet and it didn't last long either. I kept getting flea bites and I felt it was a waste of money. What eventually killed the fleas was the mixture of Borax, Baking Soda and Salt sprinkled on the carpet followed by rigorous vacuum cleaning, followed by steam carpet cleaning using only water and vinegar (and no cleaning solution) followed by more vacuum cleaning.
customer_reviews.author: Satori Girl

customer_reviews.title: Didn't work for us...
customer_reviews.text: I like the idea of the product,but it really didn't do what it said.I gave the dogs a bath,washed bedding. Also I purchased the yard and 2 other products to make sure I got all the fleas.I vacuumed followed instruction.snd the fleas are still here. The lemon grass scent is sickening we had to leave house open for hours.very disappointed....
customer_reviews.author: cheryl moore

customer_reviews.title: Recommend!
customer_reviews.text: I spent quite some time researching for natural products to combat fleas as I refuse to use products that are known to causing seizures in dogs. Well let me tell you this works! Use it regularly until the fleas are gone and believe me they will be gone!
customer_reviews.author: MarMar

customer_reviews.title: I am a repeat customer!
customer_reviews.text: I had to put my beloved rescue down after loving her for 15 years. She was diagnosed with Lymphoma. I thought I took "good" care of her, using Frontline for fleas and ticks, feeding her Blue Buffalo, and getting her vaccinated per vet recommendations. When I got my puppy, I used different health strategies: minimal vaccinations, a raw, organic food. and Wondercide for fleas and ticks. I like the smell. I use it on myself as well. She is two years old now. She never had fleas or ticks. It keeps the mosquitoes away, too.
customer_reviews.author: Jean

customer_reviews.title: I sprayed it around my patio - not on dog - and it gets rid of mosquitoes
customer_reviews.text: Wow - I just received this last week and I can see a difference already (mosquitoes had been non-stop, now I see very few). However, I am actually spraying it around my outdoor patio but not on my dog or inside the house. Now I see they have a 'yard' version, I will check the ingredients to see how that differs because this version for animals and home works just fine on my outdoor patio. I will surely re-purchase
customer_reviews.author: ChicagoGal

customer_reviews.title: Great product!
customer_reviews.text: I've been struggling with a flea infestation for a couple months now. Tried everything! Products for the dogs, products for my home and lawn, sprays, topical treatments, chewables, you name it. Nothing destroyed the full flea cycle. I used this product one time on my furniture and dogs and I haven't seen an adult flea for days. My dogs aren't​ chewing on themselves and better yet, unlike with other sprays, their skin isn't inflamed from chemicals. It's a little strong in the scent department. If you're used to citronella then this won't irritate much. The lemon smell gets to me after awhile, but I'll take the scent over fleas any day.
customer_reviews.author: Lani

customer_reviews.title: Amazing Product!
customer_reviews.text: We had a terrible tick infestation in our closed garage where we keep our dogs. Tried bombing, which helped a little but it was only after using this product that we got rid of it completely! The best thing about this product is that while it is deadly to these pests, it is gently on our animals! no toxic fumes and worrying that we or our dogs would be poisoned. In fact, there's a pleasing scent. I highly recommend if you have children or dogs and want to keep your area poison free!
customer_reviews.author: Pam

customer_reviews.title: High priced. Not amazing for intended purpose.
customer_reviews.text: I was so excited about this product. At $24 a bottle I thought this stuff would be amazing. It is not. It smells great. I love the natural idea. However in an extra humid climate where fleas thrive the only way it would help on pet bedding or pet is if you soaked them down daily. Dogs do not care for it. But they dont hate it any worse than other sprays. They actually seem to like it better. Oddly it makes a great household cleaner. Which is not it's intended use.
customer_reviews.author: Super Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: smells great.....disapointment though
customer_reviews.text: the first day we used it...it seemed to paralyze the fleas....the second day..we thought well maybe there was a hatch..by day 3 ...it seemed like they were waiting with bowls for more....it just didn't work for some reason..would spray isolated fleas and they just didn't seem effected...so back to drawing board
customer_reviews.author: stone113

customer_reviews.title: The smell is too overpowering for us to even be able to use it
customer_reviews.text: I got the lemongrass spray and OMG it was just too much. There's no way I could even remotely spray this on my cats or anywhere near them. I sprayed a little bit around our bedroom and could barely sleep in there. Had to wash our bedding and anything that the spray touched. Instant headache. It was a total waste for us, but maybe I can use it to spray around the perimeter of our house outside. I want to use it up since I bought it, but I just can't see how anyone can handle such an intense scent. It was like citronella on steroids. Yikes.
customer_reviews.author: Mustang Girl

customer_reviews.title: I like it but I don't love it
customer_reviews.text: I'm mixed between a 3 and 4 star review for this product. I like it but I don't love it, and i really wanted to love it. I sprayed it on my dog, she's 3 and about 30lbs, we're out in the woods alot, all over the east and west coast as we travel often. She still had ticks and fleas on her after we thoroughly sprayed her and of course she doesn't like the smell but that wouldn't bother me so much if the darn thing worked, after all it's natural so it doesn't harm her. Perhaps more Cedar oil? Oh well, on to another natural product.
customer_reviews.author: K. Kovacs

customer_reviews.title: Meh...Not was I was hoping for :(
customer_reviews.text: Unless you constantly spray this on your pets, you’ll continue to have a problem. We tried it- killed the fleas within about 30 mins. BUT as soon as they went back outside...more fleas. It smells SO STRONG. I can’t imagine spraying it on them enough to make it work for prevention.
customer_reviews.author: Sara W.

customer_reviews.title: Does not really work at all to repel ticks or fleas on dogs - at least not in California!
customer_reviews.text: It helps with pests, but it stinks so bad that you can't use it. It certainly does not work on fleas or ticks on dogs or in the house. It did work if sprayed directly on ants if you spray it on them or on their path. You would have to use so much of the product to be at all effective that you would have to leave the house - it really is unbearable. I felt sorry for my dogs when I sprayed them - besides not working, they couldn't stand to be with themselves!
customer_reviews.author: burntoutonsubstandardproducts

customer_reviews.title: needs continual applications to be effective.
customer_reviews.text: I was adversely affected by the strong odor. If you are sensitive to these scents, I would advise you to not use this product. It did not affect my husband. After bathing all three of our dogs, treating the lawn (with the lawn spray), carpets, bedding etc. in our home, and then spraying the dogs, there are still fleas. I realize there needs to be more treatments as new ones may be hatching, etc., but, perhaps this treatment along with something else more "lasting" would be beneficial.
customer_reviews.author: Rosemary Ryan

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic Natural Pest Protection
customer_reviews.text: Upon receiving my Wondercide, I immediately applied it and was very pleased with the smell. I was even more pleased with how effectively it worked for my dogs. We live in Maine and the early summers are filled with biting pests; black flies, mosquitoes, fleas, ticks, and more; Wondercide worked on them all. We are completely happy with the product.
customer_reviews.author: Ray Hedgpath

customer_reviews.title: This does not feel like a "natural" product
customer_reviews.text: The smell is so overwhelming that both my dogs and I were struggling to get through the day. The product smells more like crude oil, not a natural and safe product. My dogs hated it. The fleas seem to have gone away for a few days and now they are scratching again in spite of spraying the whole house.
customer_reviews.author: Magdalena Wszelaki, author of "Cooking for Hormone Balance"

customer_reviews.title: Do not use!!!
customer_reviews.text: I was so hopeful for this product. Our border collie loves being outside, and living in the Maine woods is a tick problem. I sprayed under her belly and her back tonight, and withing 10 minutes she began licking the floor, (which she doea not do). I immediately took her outside, and started washing her with warm water. She continued to lick dirt and rocks. I took warm water and baking soda and rinsed her mouth. This product also acted like soap suds when water was added to it. She has not been groomed in 6 weeks, so it is not residue. I would not recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works!!!  Must reapply faithfully
customer_reviews.text: Love this product. works on fleas, ticks, ants and mosquitoes. I've seen it kill ants on contact and keep mosquitos away completely (both myself and my dogs). If I use it faithfully my dogs do not have fleas and ticks - as several of my dogs have contracted erlichia whilst on name brand topicals, it's important to us to keep ticks off our dogs - and off us!!! We have sprayed captured ticks and it kills them immediately. we also use it on the lawn - it keeps biting bees away as well!
customer_reviews.author: LT

customer_reviews.title: Not Accurate. My dog still has some fleas
customer_reviews.text: I bought this about a month ago. I sprayed as instructed on the label. My dog still till this day has fleas. I find them less then before but still. I have sprayed the furniture, around the entrance etc. I still find fleas on her and it's really frustrating since this is spray has a VERY VERY STRONG SMELL. The first night my family we not able to sleep since it was so strong. Overall, I saw very few changes, and I believe this was way too expensive for its quality.
customer_reviews.author: Buchii

customer_reviews.title: It works and helps but does not replace treatments.
customer_reviews.text: It works and the lemongrass scent was pleasant. I used it on both the animals (dog and cat) with no ill effects. The animals didn’t like it much though. It did kill flees but I think only when the solution is first applied and wet. For a none chemical safer option it’s nice but will no resolve your flees issues on its own. It’s does help.
customer_reviews.author: Michael M.

customer_reviews.title: Sorry that it failed.  Stinks grotesquely.
customer_reviews.text: Sorry, it totally did not work. I have 3 dogs and so I bought 2 bottles so I would have enough. Did not hurt the dogs and no skin reaction, but the smell on them made me wretch. Having them close was IMPOSSIBLE for me. Husband agreed it stunk, but did not gag from it. We also got the outdoor one, and that smelled better and unknown if it worked. Wanted natural, went back to poison for a successful end to ticks and fleas.
customer_reviews.author: noel Alt

customer_reviews.title: Great non-chemical flea and tick treatment
customer_reviews.text: We are in our first month of using this and are pleased so far! I heard wonderful things about it from a friend and decided to try it on our goldendoodle and orange tabby cat. So far it’s doing a great job! Our pets don’t like smelling like lemongrass but I sure do! Easy to use.
customer_reviews.author: April Emery

customer_reviews.title: Only useful before it dries
customer_reviews.text: Only works while it’s still wet. Once it dries it’s done working. Love the smell of the lemongrass but is overwhelming if you spray a whole area.
customer_reviews.author: Julie

customer_reviews.title: Cedar smells awful but if it works...
customer_reviews.text: I hate the smell of cedar but I need something to keep the fleas off my dogs. The lemongrass scent is slightly less offensive initially but is still just as cedar smelling after the lemongrass smell wears off. As long as it kills the fleas I won't complain. Just sprayed the dogs down yesterday. Will apply again in another day to kill any eggs that may have hatched since the first spray. Will update!
customer_reviews.author: Three Dog Circus

customer_reviews.title: The smell of it! Ugh!!
customer_reviews.text: I am sure this product must be safe and effective. But the smell!! It is strong and overpowering. I cannot take the smell and neither will my cats. They now refuse to use the cat tower that I sprayed with it. I can’t imagine actually spraying it on my animal. They wouldn’t be able to get away from the scent. Ugh! The rest of it is going straight into the trash
customer_reviews.author: California Rose

customer_reviews.title: WORTHLESS AND HAS STRONG ODER
customer_reviews.text: This product doesn't work. I've sprayed the same area twice already (wooden floor with and area carpet) and the fleas are thriving. Worst of all the smell permeates nearby rooms in the house (open floor plan). Smell lasts for several days. ANYONE spraying it on their animals should be reported for animal cruelty and FORCED FED the contents of the bottle. I wish Amazon would allow zero stars. I try using natural products but this is just a smelly product that does NOTHING.
customer_reviews.author: Pete

customer_reviews.title: Amazing for fleas
customer_reviews.text: Wow this is better then I specter, My little girl is free of fleas and smells good. And besides it when I sprayed on her Some got on my arms, And when I got by I like evening with her not a single mosquito land on me. Loveee it thank you
customer_reviews.author: Omar Jor-el

customer_reviews.title: Still trying the product
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this for my schnauzer and Yorkie. I didn't want to use chemicals I wanted something natural and safe since my dogs have sensitive skin. I used the yard product and the spray for my pets and carpet. I am not sure how often i should use because I used 3 days ago and picked up my yorkie last night and he had a flea on him. My schnauzer didn't let me check him but I am pretty sure he might have 2 or 3 he is still scratching. I will keep using and hopefully it gets better.
customer_reviews.author: Gina Fernandez

customer_reviews.title: Good smelling scent
customer_reviews.text: used this on my couch and pillows. The scent isnt bad and seemed to help with flea control. The scent does last a pretty long time so be prepared for things to smell like lemon grass for a bit. I liked it cause it is all natural and not harsh on fabric.
customer_reviews.author: lloyd

customer_reviews.title: Safe for pets
customer_reviews.text: I buy this for my dogs every year. flea and tick season can be harmful to your pets. This spray is great for keeping those pests off your pet. I use it every other week just to make sure it's not too much stuff for my doggies. I like the spray and it has a pleasant scent. The price is reasonable and it does the job. Good vendor!
customer_reviews.author: Guadalupe Morales

customer_reviews.title: Terrible smell
customer_reviews.text: Sprayed product on carpet and dog bed; no more than 7 squirts. Within 10 minutes it affected our breathing and smelled like chemicals. Our cat started blinking her eyes and ran out of the room. Our dog hung her head and looked miserable. We opened the doors to encourage air flow but the smell lingered all night long. In the morning I saw residue on the floor around the dog bed where I had sprayed. I would never even think of putting this on our animals' coats after that experience and would not recommend this product to anyone with a respiratory condition or chemical sensitivities. We have neither and found this product to be offensive.
customer_reviews.author: Christine

customer_reviews.title: So far so good
customer_reviews.text: I have used this product a handful of times on my dog and have had no issues so far and reacts well to it. My dog does have congestive heart failure so my vet has asked that I don't spray it directly on his fur but to use a cloth or my hand as we don't want to hurt his lungs with the smell. I use spray it on my hands first and then rub it on my dog's fur. I hope this product works to protect against heart worm but won't know until I do a blood test in the future.
customer_reviews.author: C. Pal

customer_reviews.title: DID NOT WORK!!!!
customer_reviews.text: I have 5 dogs ( rescues) and 3 cats ( also rescued) in Florida, all my animals are on flea prevention, yet still get fleas , I was REALLY hoping this stuff would work , but it does not !! My dogs still had fleas on them as did cats , I’ve sprayed them every time they go out , bedding etc - the smell is overpowering so much it gives me a headache , my husband came home from work and as soon as he got out of his truck he could tell I sprayed this !! It may repel mosquitoes but NOT FLEAS!! I even sprayed directly on a flea it did nothing ! Very disappointing 😞
customer_reviews.author: beth green

customer_reviews.title: I should have read the reviews regarding the spray bottle.
customer_reviews.text: Annoyed that I bought a product that is advertised as a spray bottle. I only received the bottle, no spray. So now I need to either go out and purchase a spray bottle or return without using the product. It would be great if the product was advertised correctly.
customer_reviews.author: lexigirl

customer_reviews.title: Still waiting to see
customer_reviews.text: We used this on all 3 of our dogs and our 2 cats and they slowed down the itching and I thought it had worked. A couple of hours later, they were back at it again. The bottle also arrived without a spray nozzle and they only one we had at home doesn't fit it the best. It made it difficult to spray 3 resistant dogs. I will be doing another application within the next day or 2.
customer_reviews.author: enamom

customer_reviews.title: Best Bug Spray!!!
customer_reviews.text: I LOVE this brand!! Ive been using it for several years now and it’s so effective. I spray both of my dogs 1x a week along with all entryways and windows to keep bugs out. I also use it on my lemon tree to avoid using any harsh chemicals. I think it’s all about consistency with this product to make it truly effective. I also don’t mind the smell but if you’re sensitive to it you’ll want to make sure to have all windows open when you spread indoors so that the smell subsides quickly.
customer_reviews.author: BrendaC

customer_reviews.title: Very Pleased
customer_reviews.text: I live in a heavy tick area and I won't use chemicals on my immune compromised animals or myself. Have been using Wondercide products for a couple years on myself and my animals and am very pleased.
customer_reviews.author: Nancy Ciraldo

customer_reviews.title: Not as good as it used to be
customer_reviews.text: It's not as good as it used to be. I heard they took a important chemical out to make it work better to save money. Not sure this is true or not. But I use it to try and keep fleas away. I did just get two ticks after using this
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Too Smelly...
customer_reviews.text: The smell! I sprayed my pets & rugs & I had to immediately bathe them & wash the roofs & mop the floors. The smell of citronella is so overpowering. I have inside dogs & the smell gave me a severe headache! Sorry I did not like it. And I bought the soap & spray. I don't even know if the product works cuz it was not on long enough. My dogs are not infested with fleas I just wanted something more safe for them but this is too smelly.
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth

product_meta.title: Wondercide Natural Products - Flea, Tick and Mosquito Control Spray for Dogs, Cats, and Home - Flea and Tick Killer, Prevention, Treatment - Eco-Friendly and Family Safe
feature_bullets: KILLS & REPELS. Using natural essential oils, this spray is proven to kill by contact, repel and prevent 98-100% of fleas, ticks and mosquitoes. It eliminates the entire pest life cycle, including eggs, larvae and adults.

NO HARSH CHEMICALS. A safe alternative to collars, pills, chewables and drops that's naturally-derived and just as effective. Holistic vet approved. Enjoy peace of mind knowing your pets and home are protected.

SAFE FOR DOGS, CATS OF ALL AGES. Gentle enough to use on puppies, kittens, and senior pets as often as needed, yet powerful enough to fully eliminate pests on the skin and fur. Safe to use around the entire family. Kid-safe. Mom owned, Mom approved.

3-IN-1 PLANT-BASED SOLUTION. For dogs, cats, and home! A home remedy that kills fleas throughout the house on carpet, furniture, bedding, and flooring. Also a repellent in pet environments like dog kennels or cat condos. Invigorating Lemongrass scent freshens homes.

POWERFULLY EFFECTIVE. Powered by nature and proven to work. Give your pet the best advantage in protection against fleas and ticks without harsh chemicals. Cruelty free, biodegradable, and Made in the U.S.A.

specifications.Customer Reviews: /** Fix for UDP-1061. Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
